description.narrative:
Sida is planning for support to the "National Environment Management Council", NEMC, in Tanzania. NEMC is Tanzania's equivalent of the Swedish Environmental Protection Agency, SEPA. The support to NEMC is appraised and agreed separately from this contribution.
This contribution intends to enable the Swedish EPA to participate in the abovementioned project with NEMC.
The project with NEMC focus mainly on strengthening the environmental regulation in Tanzania, both at central and local level, by completing missing part of the Environmental Management Act and local by-laws. Capacity building is also included, mainly on environmental impact assessments for the environmental permit process.
The Swedish EPA will assist NEMC in drafting the new legislation and advise on the development of the environmental permit process.
A comprehensive and complete environment legislation framework is a prerequisite for managing possible environmental impacts of industrial activities, public services, business and activities in sectors such as tourism, fishing and agriculture.

Sida överväger stöd till "National Environment Management Council", NEMC, i Tanzania. NEMC är tanzanias motsvarighet till Naturvårdsverket. Stödet till NEMC bereds och avtalas separat från denna insats.
Denna insats avser Naturvårdsverkets medverkan i projektet med NEMC.
Projektet med NEMC avser komplettera ännu ofullständiga delar av tanzanias motsvarighet till miljöbalken, samt tillhörande förordningar och föreskrifter. Även insatser för att stärka kapaciteten hos NEMC är inkluderade, framför allt med fokus på miljökonsekvensbeskrivningar (MKB).
Naturvårdsverkets medverkan i projektet avser stöd till NEMC i arbetet med kompletterande regelverk och rådgivning kring MKB och tillståndsprocesser.
En fullgod miljölagstiftning är en förutsättning för att kunna hantera eventuella miljökonsekvenser av industriell verksamhet, kommunal service, företagsamhet, samt näringar såsom turism, fiske och lantbruk.

Sida is supporting Tanzania's National Environment Management Council (NEMC) and the environment department in the Vice President's Office (VPO), a project which the Swedish Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) is part of. The main project with NEMC and VPO, with its reporting and budget, is managed in another contribution. This separate intervention is setup to manage only the involvement of the Swedish EPA, including their budget and their activities. The Swedish EPA will through this project support NEMC/VPO with drafting of environmental legislation and local by-laws, with training of staff, training of environment inspectors, training of EIA experts e.g. in environmental permitting processes and with the building up of systems for awareness and networking. At the end of this project it is expected that SEPA has contributed substantially, through their input and advise, to the goals of the NEMC/VPO project which are a completed Environmental Management Act including local by-laws, enhanced capacity of public environmental officials, improved processes for environmental licencing and improved working relations with the public and e.g. industry.

description.narrative:
The EMA project has been delayed considerably due to various reasons. This in turn has affected SEPAs project due to its design with service provision as requested when implementing the EMA. Although severe postponements since start have meant that the project has not taken off completely, some services were requested from SEPA from the VPO during 2021.
As part of getting the EMA project started a number of procurements and basic functions needs to be completed by the VPO/NEMC. These relate to consulting services and other planned measures for specific analyses that needs to be carried out before the EMA project can be rolled out fully. Therefore, SEPA performed all required tasks as requested by partners and mentioned in bullets below: - SEPA evaluated and provided input to the ToR for Developing Web-Based System for Processing Applications. - SEPA provided overarching comments and recommendations for development of an EWaste Management system. - SEPA evaluated and provided input to the overall methodology, work plan and strategic measures suggested related to the EMA implementation. - SEPA provided overarching comments and recommendations to the ToR of preparing an EMAP for Dodoma City. - SEPA provided brief response and comments to the Proposed ToR for National Waste Management Strategy.
During the year, SEPA also participated in the 1st Meeting of The Project Steering Committee. The meeting offered an opportunity to present current and planned activities within the EMA project and share perspectives on the continued implementation of both projects.
